alert.note: Alert for La Paz; Maricopa; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 18 at 5:36PM MST until August 18 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... East central La Paz County in west central Arizona... Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 630 PM MST. * At 535 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Painted Rock Dam to 7 miles southeast of Paloma to 24 miles south of Mohawk, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 22 and 99. Locations impacted include... Wellton, Painted Rock Dam, Tacna, Sentinel, Paloma, Tyson, Dateland, Ligurta, Sundad, Mohawk, Roll, and Hyder. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
